## Renato Borras-Chavez

Hola! Im Renato Borras-Chavez, PhD. Im a 2nd-year Postdoctoral Researcher working at Rhode Island University in the United States. I am an ecophysiologist working in what I call "Integrative Predator Ecology", in my case, the interface between foraging ecology, population ecology and Physiology. In the last 10 years, my research models have mostly been pinnipeds. Since I am Chilean, most of my work has been done in Chilean species as well as Antarctic species. Before these ten years I was lucky enough to also work in subtidal ecology, specifically in ecology of Kelp forest. This gave me a broader perspective of how ecosystems work and are regulated and the "integrative" word of my research is also the result of accepting a big integration of multidisciplines, approaches and collaborators for the understanding and conservation of the ecoystems I work in. 
:::
:::{.g-col-12 .mx-4}
You can explore more in depth my scientific work (Research), fieldwork experience (Fieldwork), Colaborative Network (Network), and the service to profession I provide and my attempts of sciences communication and outreach (Service & Outreach). Please feel free to contact me if you want to discuss more about my research or if you want to work together! 

Best,

Renato
:::

:::
